did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.physdesc: 9 photographs: black & white; sepia, 20 x 25 cm.
did.abstract: Photographs of Spanish-American War encampment sites, soldiers, and civilians, taken in Prince William County, Va.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
See the
Univeristy of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Spanish-American War Photographs, 1898, Accession #10955, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These photographs were purchased by the Library from Jerry N. Showalter, Bookseller, Ivy, Virginia, on June 4, 1990.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of nine sepia and black and white photographs, originally taken in 1898, of Spanish-American War encampment sites and soldiers in training in Prince William County, Virginia. Identified locations and persons include Thoroughfare Gap, Walnut Farm, Cloverland, Mill Park, members of the Heineken family, Edward F. Wilkens, and Newton Ball.
